intro: Fimbristylis ochreata, commonly known as the yellow flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Oceania. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often yellow or brown in color. Fimbristylis ochreata is adapted to moist or aquatic environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in some regions for landscaping purposes.
